Package: com.github.jrubygradle.jar.internal

[Groovy] Class JRubyDirInfoTransformer

    • com.github.jrubygradle.jar.internal.JRubyDirInfoTransformer
    • All Implemented Interfaces and Traits:
      com.github.jengelman.gradle.plugins.shadow.transformers.Transformer

      class JRubyDirInfoTransformer
extends java.lang.Object

      JRubyDirInfoTransformer implements a com.github.jengelman.gradle.plugins.shadow.transformers.Transformer interface. This is internal primarily because it rewrequires an interaction with the transformer interface inside of the shadow plugin, which will hopefully go away at some point in the future

      • Constructor Detail

        • JRubyDirInfoTransformer()

      • Method Detail

        • boolean canTransformResource(org.gradle.api.file.FileTreeElement element)

          Register the relative path of the element that will be jarred. Since this transformer is just performing book-keeping, it returns false to avoid telling the machinery in shadow to transform the actual file being visited and jarred up

          Returns:
          false

        • protected void deleteTempDirectory(java.io.File directory)

          Recursively delete the given java.io.File

        • boolean hasTransformedResource()

          Confirm that we've done some work so our modifyOutputStream is called

          Returns:
          true

        • void modifyOutputStream(org.apache.tools.zip.ZipOutputStream os)

          Process the output stream and add our .jrubydir entries. This method will also clean up our tempdir to make sure we don't clutter the user's machine with junk

        • protected void processDirectory(org.apache.tools.zip.ZipOutputStream stream, java.io.File directory)

          Process the directory given and ensure that all our .jrubydir files are added.

          Parameters:
          stream - org.apache.tools.zip.ZipOutputStream for our archive being built
          directory - Directory which contains our .jrubydir files to be copied

        • void transform(java.lang.String path, java.io.InputStream is, java.util.List<com.github.jengelman.gradle.plugins.shadow.relocation.Relocator> relocators)

          No-op since we don't transform the actual file
